name: incestuousness
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the fact of involving sexual activity between people who are closely related and not legally allowed to marry: It’s a tale of Gothic incestuousness based on a novel by an Atlanta author. the incestuousness of their relationship
disapproving the quality of involving only a close or limited group of people, who do not communicate or do business with people outside the group: People are tired of the revolving-door incestuousness of Washington and Wall Street. Political incestuousness is routine at all levels. See
incestuous
More examplesFewer examplesShe plays the part of the mother with a suggestive incestuousness under the maternal warmth.His portrait of the incestuousness and random cruelty of small-town life is accurate.The sitcom became an unwitting dramatic critique of celebrity incestuousness.
